bibl.title: Letter from William N. Hill to Howard A. Kelly, October 10, 1907

div1.p: Hill apologizes for his and King's absence from the Maryland Club meeting.

div1.head: Letter from William N. Hill to Howard A. Kelly, October 10, 1907
div1.opener:
DR. WM. N. HILL,
PRESIDENT.
V
DANIEL MACODROM,
SECRETARY.
Twentieth Century Club
INCORPORATED UNDER THE LAWS OF MARYLAND
JANUARY 2, 1907.
CHARLES L. SWIGERT,
823 EQUITABLE BUILDING,
CHAIRMAN COMMITTEE OF ARRANGEMENTS
JAMESTOWN EXPOSITION EXCURSIONS.
DR. WM. N. HILL
508 W. MULBERRY ST.
BALTIMORE, MD.
BALTIMORE, MD. Oct 10 1907
Dr Howard. A. Kelly,
Dear Dr
div1.p:
I am as much ashamed of the
rediculous mistake as to date of dinner as Dr King
as stated in his enclosed letter which I received this
morning.

When I received your note inviting me to the
dinner I marked the date on calendar and instead of
the 14th marked 7th. With your note I received a
lot of other mail and the note was mixed up with
letters and I could not find it until Sunday.
I immediately wrote to Dr King stating the error
I had made and find that he also erred.

It is needless for me to state that I regret exceedingly
giving you any distress about the matter.
The old saying is that Lawyers mistakes are matters
of public record but the doctors are buried under six
foot of soil. I hope Dr Kings and my own will in
this instance follow the usual course of medical
mens mistakes as indicated
